existing_custody_order.reasoning: Complaint alleges an existing probate court order entered March 15, 2020 providing Plaintiff primary physical custody and Defendant midweek Wednesday overnight and every-other-weekend parenting time (¶5–6).

specific_modification_sought.reasoning: Complaint specifies concrete relief: suspend/terminate Defendant's Wednesday overnight midweek parenting time, modify the weekend schedule with several enumerated alternatives, set exchange/logistics provisions, and request temporary relief pending hearing (¶15, WHEREFORE B–C).

material_substantial_change.reasoning: Complaint alleges Defendant accepted employment in New Hampshire and intends to relocate, causing midweek overnights to require ~90-minute drives each way and making the prior schedule impracticable—facts pled as a substantial change since the 2020 order (¶7–11, ¶13).

best_interests_of_child.reasoning: Complaint alleges how the proposed modifications serve Sophie's best interests: minimizing long midweek travel, preserving school attendance and extracurricular participation, reducing stress/anxiety (including observed changes in Sophie's demeanor), and preventing material harm to education and emotional well‑being (¶8–9, ¶11, ¶14–16).
